poem:
Title: The Arithmetic of Sorrow

Lean faces shadowed by the tolling bell,
Sixty-three pence upon every coin,
Yet hunger and cold hold us in their spell.
Brown pleads for action, strong and great, 
A gauntlet thrown at Hunt's gate.
The harvest missed, the larder thin,
Yields no relief from the harsh din of want.
Wake, chancellor, to poverty's haunting cant.
